name: Luxe Sunset Boulevard Hotel

reviews.title: Don't Bother Booking a Room Here
reviews.text: Don't waste your time or your money staying here. I recently stayed there and everything was a DISASTER. Where do I start?

1) When I asked the valet for a ticket, I was told "I gave you one yesterday". I told the guy that was impossible since it was my first time at the hotel. I finally asked the guy if this was a joke and then he said that he had mixed me up with someone else.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay - Nice Staff

reviews.text: 2) The acutal check-in/taking of my credit card was quick. However, getting to my room was a nightmare. I was sent to a room where there was a rag and large commercial fan on the floor. I called the front desk and an employee came to the room. She stated "not again, this happened yesterday". She said I couldn't stay in the room because the carpet was wet. It took 20 minutes back and forth with the front desk to finally get transferred to another room. First, I was told someone was bringing me new keys. Then I was told, to go down and get the keys. Then someone called back and said they were coming up. Each time it was a different person. Talk about a lack of communication. Finally, someone came up with new keys but he was dumb enough to ask "so what's wrong with this room. I opened the door wide open and he said "oh"....
reviews.title: Worst nights sleep ever.

reviews.text: 3) Room service is overpriced and BLAND. Also the hotel does not list the room service charges and service charge prices. I travel for business and pleasure frequently and this is the first time I have never seen this information published.
reviews.title: Could be great but isn't.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The server forgot my receipt. He said that he would be right back. Of course, he never came back. I had to call the front desk in order to get a receipt for my expenses.
reviews.title: Queen of Customer Service - Katrina Butts!

reviews.text: Victoria & David Beckahm stayed there before. Luxurious, High Standard, A++, Chauffeurs, Pool, with many extras.
reviews.title: Luxurious, High Standard, A++, Chauffeurs, Pool, etc.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Luxe for two nights recently. There are lots of good things to say about this hotel. When we first arrived, we were told that we'd been upgraded from a King to a "junior executive suite" -- which isn't really a suite (no extra additional room) but just has an extra alcove with a sitting area. At any rate, the room was huge and very tastefully decorated. We also got free parking & free breakfast passes for each day we were there. Although the breakfast passes said they were only good for the continental breakfast (which was gross), the second day we were told that we could actually just use the passes as a credit towards other stuff on the menu. So the second day we had a much better breakfast and it was free -- yay!
reviews.title: Nice hotel but too hard to sleep there

reviews.text: At first blush, we were feeling pretty good about the place. We found all the people working there to be very friendly and helpful. No complaints whatsoever.
reviews.title: Not a good experience at all. VERY thin walls / got little sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fast forward to the evening. First of all, the mattress is SUPER firm. So every time my husband would move, even the teeniest bit, the whole bed would shake. That would have woken me up numerous times, had I been asleep... but the walls are so freaking thin that sleep was not happening for us. (our daughter was trying to sleep on the rollaway bed they brought in). The people next door played their TV for what seemed like all night. I don't think they even had the volume on all that loud, but it kept us up. And of course the idiotic drunken revellers stumbling down the hall at god knows what time ... very loud, too.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One other thing to note is that if you are staying in the upper building, where the pool, spa, etc. are -- there is no walkway or stairs between the upper building and the lower building (where the restaurant is). You have to walk down a steep street that has about a foot-wide "pedestrian lane" but it's a blind curve and there are crazy cab drivers careening around the corner. We didn't feel safe walking this path with our six-year-old, so we had to rely on the shuttle which was kind of annoying since it's actually not all that far; it seemed to silly to have to get a ride to and from the main building but that was the only safe way to do it.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great value
RUN AWAY! ...as fast as you can!
reviews.text: If you're looking for a hotel with NO service, this is the place for you! There is an overall lack of management at this property. Not enough staff is the biggest fault. The upkeep at this property is non-existent: rooms (and I visiting a few of them) have broken door hardware, outlets, bath fixtures, and non-operating refridges. The grounds around the pool and buildings are not maintained (weeds and small trash are seen in many corners of the exteriors). Good luck getting anyone to bring a few towels up to the pool! The unfortunate logistics of the parking on the property are worsened by the fact that the front desk (10 feet away from the front valet stand) refuse to coordinate with the sub-contracted valet/parking folks. An antiquated phone system doesn't allow you to call them either... that would make sense, and anything that seems logical is absent from this hotel. One again, I blame the G.M. of this hotel... and guess what?... there ISN'T even a manager at this hotel... actually told this by the front desk personnel! Now THAT'S logical, huh? I live in Los Angeles and book my visiting clients in local hotels. I'm glad I never sent any of them here before seeing for myself. PLEASE do not be enticed by the low rates and great deals that can be found for this hotel. And one last dig... the 'spa' was running 1 1/2 hours behind on their appointments for treatments. Ridiculous. I couldn't keep waiting, so I had to cancel my massage reservation due to other plans. Run away!

reviews.title: Believe the hype...
reviews.text: I'd read the reviews before staying here, but I had to try the property due to the corporate rate my client had negotiated with Luxe. The hotel staff were very nice on check-in, no complaints there. And the room was large, also nice. However... the air conditioning didn't work (except for brief 5 minute periods), the parking was a nightmare, the road noise from 405 was ridiculous, the bed was hard, and the carpets looked vintage (read: not cleaned in the last 50 years). I wouldn't stay here again. Not a fan.

reviews.title: Loved the Luxe
reviews.text: I read mixed reviews on this hotel so was somewhat concerned. Arrived there and hotel staff was very courteous. Had a room by the spa that had a terrific view of LA from the patio. Room was very clean. Went to a wedding that evening and when I returned the coffee was refreshed and the beds were turned down. Very nice. Very close to the 405 and the Getty. Had some time to kill so went on a nice drive down Sunset to Pacific Palisades. Overall was very pleased and don't know what the bad reviewers expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good, the size not too large and not too small, the service was friendly and efficient ... all in all a fine choice. The beds were also nice and there was FREE internet access near the front desk.
reviews.title: A good, if not perfect, choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are two drawbacks. First, one is dependent on a car (who doesn't have a car when in LA?). Second, due to the age of the hotel, the rooms are not always perfectly quiet (was built in the 60's?). Also, if one is unlucky, there will also be background traffic noise in some of the rooms.
reviews.title: Nasty Food, Receptionist gave us a room key to a room ALREADY TAKEN!

reviews.text: We stayed twice for 5 and 2 nights respectively. During the first 5 nights, we had one night with elephant step neighbors above us (can people really walk SO heavily uninterupted for HOURS?) and a pacing telefoner on the patio next door who was obviously hard of hearing and didn't care whether we knew all his business details. Having said that, the other nights were quiet and we slept like babies in the very comfortable bed. During our second stay, we requested a move from the freeway to the pool side and were lucky that there was a vacant room available. The junior suite was spacious.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: Very nice parking valet service ... 24/7. Also a free shuttle available to the Getty. There is a fitness room where everything works. There is also a spa, which we did not use.
reviews.title: I loved this place!

reviews.text: It seems in LA you have the choice between the cheapies which are often on busy streets or the 5 star hotels. If you need something in between, the Luxe would suit - adequate 4 star range. Also, for being on the westside of town, it is ideally located.
reviews.title: A Gem
Nice, but
reviews.text: Huge room - almost uncomfortably so - for a solo traveler (over 600 sqft); nice amenities; separate shower booth, etc.
The hotel consists of 2 building (main and the spa tower). I was assigned to the latter, and you would like a ride from the main tower because of the steep uphill (the hotel does offer a ride).
reviews.title: Lovely, serene and comfy

likes.liked: — Comfy bed, design, cleanliness, furniture quality, location
likes.disliked: — Mandatory valet parking and fees! Weird topography on hillside.

reviews.text: Internet - can be improved (wireless).
reviews.title: Missing attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Valet parking - takes long because short-staffed.
reviews.title: Nice on the outside, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast - need a car to the nearest Starbucks, so you'd probably eat at the hotel restaurant (about $20).
reviews.title: Amazing Service and Ambiance

likes.disliked: — The Snickers bar in the mini fridge was $3.50!!! haha

reviews.text: Arrived at hotel after dark - entrance alley was extremely dark, wasn't exactly clear where to go. I think some exterior lighting would be nice. Very hard to pull out of this alley onto Sunset if you are making a left, I really think the car (well, Escalade) that almost hit me sped up to try make a point.
reviews.title: Lipstick on a pig

reviews.text: Hotel common areas are very nice and well designed, but this hotel just feels like an upgraded average hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel if you can stay in Santa Monica

reviews.text: Rooms were odd - big rooms, small TV for a room this size; tv remote not very responsive; desk didn't have any power outlets, bathroom shower was nice, but an old small tub, toilet stopped flushing the morning I checked out. Room had two beds, each bed had lots of fashion pillows, but then only one regular pillow. Room was "connecting" to next door, had the fun of hearing unruly children in the evening and the morning.
reviews.title: A wonderful Oasis for Greater L.A.

reviews.text: Just overpriced, average hotel with lots of lipstick.
reviews.title: Trying to be more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had the pleasure of staying at the Luxe recently. Staff was great and courteous. When checking in, there were suites available and they quickly upgraded me without a question. The suite was wonderful - big (probably 1,000 square feet) and the bathroom was outstanding - marble stone all the way through and separate shower and tub. Room was definitely A+.
reviews.title: The staff here deserves recognition

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just stayed at the Luxe for one nite (vacation travel) -- thought the place was pretty appealing and also thought - if they could just put a bit more money into it - it could really be a little gem.
reviews.title: The Little Hotel that Could

reviews.text: Our room was initially a poolside view, second floor in the upper building - the room had a nice little balcony and you could not hear any noise from the 405, it was quite charming. Room furnishings were fine by me (but the refrigerator looked like it came out of someone's dorm room) We did hear a loud hum/motor come on and I think it was the airconditioning units above us up on the roof - I think if they could find a way to dampen this sound it would be really good, as if you stayed here in hot weather and that was cycling on/off all the time it could be quite annoying.
reviews.title: Liked the Luxe...

description: The Luxe Hotel Sunset Boulevard is an in-town boutique resort, situated on seven secluded and beautifully landscaped acres in one of Southern California's most accessible and exceptional locations. Located at the entrance to the exclusive suburbs of Bel-Air and Brentwood and just below the famed Getty Center, and minutes from UCLA, the hotel is at the gateway to Los Angeles and its surrounding communities. The hotel offers a stylish and supremely comfortable California-modern look and welcoming, professional, personalized care.
